title: Britney Spears to launch a new pop-up fan experience entitled The Zone
text:
Britney Spears fans will be able to immerse themselves in the scenes of some of the pop star's most iconic music videos when the premier Britney Spears fan experience arrives in Los Angeles come January 2020.

Spears will be at the center of The Zone, a pop-up and retail shop that commemorates her career in the form of hyper-detailed rooms based on hits like Hit Me Baby One More Time as well as Toxic, which took place in an airplane that's also featured in the temporary exhibition.

The airplane features interactive content on the windows and user-controlled activations, according to reports by Breathe Heavy.

All the way up: The airplane features interactive content on the windows and user-controlled activations, according to reports by Breathe Heavy

Images of the experience available on the exhibit's website also show pastel-painted lockers from the high school-set Hit Me Baby One More Time video.

One of the 10 exhibits in The Zone will also include a Circus-themed room that features a 40-foot tightrope photo walk, a live ringmaster, and a tarot card reader.

And a Mars-themed set will be in place to for all of the Oops I Did It Again fans out there.

Cute: Images of the experience available on the exhibit's website also show pastel-painted lockers from the high school-set Hit Me Baby One More Time video

Far out: And a Mars-themed set will be in place to for all of the Oops I Did It Again fans out there

Disco: Memorabilia and signature items will be available for purchase throughout the shop

Memorabilia and signature items will be available for purchase throughout the shop.

'As devoted Britney fans, we created The Zone as a thank you for the years of joy she has brought to all of our lives,' Jeff Delson, lead producer for The Zone and CEO of Black Sky Creative, the production company at the helm of the project, said in a statement.

'Britney loves her fans more than anything. Nothing, absolutely nothing, compares to The Zone.

Devoted: 'Britney loves her fans more than anything. Nothing, absolutely nothing, compares to The Zone,' Jeff Delson, lead producer for The Zone and CEO of Black Sky Creative, the production company at the helm of the project, said in a statement; seen in July

'The scale of the venue, the breakthrough technologies, the fashion, the surprises, the special access we were given, and the sheer fun of it all will truly blow people away. As it should be for the Princess of Pop.'

The space is 30,000 square feet and near 3rd & Fairfax in Los Angeles.

Tickets are on sale this Friday, November 1st, at 11 am PST.

Today's announcement comes in line with the 10th anniversary of Spears' album Blackout on Wednesday.
description: Britney Spears fans will be able to immerse themselves in the scenes of some of the pop star's most iconic music videos when the premier Britney Spears fan experience arrives in LA.
